transcript.text: another email what is mr. Hitchens
opinion of Noam Chomsky and Chomsky's
popularity among the left well I used to
be on like the terms of the first John's
game and I've reread the stuff of his
that I used to admire in particular an
essay he wrote on general Sharon in
Lebanon in 1982 or three another essay
he wrote on the American press and East
Timor and I was rather pleased to find
that though we've since some diversion
on so many things that I still thought
those were great essays and brilliantly
written and believe me Elliot I don't
think he's writing as bravely or argue
as well now and I think it has to do
with the impossible task he set himself
of effectively explaining away and
Islamic jihadism as a function of
American policy mistakes I think he
began doing this a little earlier
actually in during the Bosnian war which
is when we first began to disagree where
he almost seemed to write as if the
United States was looking to punish the
Milosevic regime because it was a
gallant socialist exception to the
general trend of globalization and
needed to be pulled back into line I
thought anyone who could interpret what
was happening in the Balkans that way
where my loss which was the was the
aggressor so palpably was was losing
perspective and I'm afraid that's what
Professor Chomsky has crucially done
